American Idol's season-one co-host Brian Dunkleman admits to having been extremely freaked out the first time he saw Simon Cowell tell someone they should never sing again. It's one thing to watch it on television, but then you spend time with these kids and you have to look at them right in the eyes, and then their mother is looking at you, like, "What just happened?'? for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

billion, or 67pc while revenues from outside of the United States totaled US$ 4.38 billion, representing 52pc of total revenues. "Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year," said Eric Schmidt . Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. Google changes its management structure While Eric Schmidt will step down as CEO he will assume the role of executive chairman focusing on deals, partnerships and broader business relationships as well as advising founders Larry Page

He can create, improvise with his feet, go to his second and third choice in the route because he has such a quick release. The room erupted in applause after one delegate at today's event quizzed Steve Ballmer on the fine print in MS licensing, which could trip up unwary users. Steve Ballmer says he has no plans to simplify licensing. Customers want simplification to reduce costs; our shareholders want simplification without price decreases. Someone may choose a processor based licence for SQL Server, while another may decide on a server-based client access licence. Both offer lower costs depending on how they are deployed.
